title: Papa Fall
text:
Papa Massé Mbaye Fall is a Senegalese-born Bissau-Guinean <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and coach. His playing position is a goalkeeper and he is the goalkeeper coach of A.D. Polideportivo Aguadulce.
International career.
He made his international debut for <a href="Guinea-Bissau%20national%20football%20team">Guinea-Bissau</a> against <a href="Zambia%20national%20football%20team">Zambia</a> on 4 June 2016. His eligibility for Guinea-Bissau has been questioned by the <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Zambia">Football Association of Zambia</a>, that sent a complaint to the <a href="Confederation%20of%20African%20Football">Confederation of African Football</a>.
His eligibility was upheld on 22 August 2016, confirming Guinea-Bissau's cup of Nations qualification.
Personal life.
He is the younger brother of FIFA referee <a href="Ousmane%20Fall">Ousmane Fall</a>.
